intro: Barleria fulvostellata subsp. axillaris, commonly known as the yellow barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it both visually appealing and ecologically beneficial to local wildlife.
